author: rdzien
body:
## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
 New-Object System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 | Format-List -Property *
```

## Expected behavior
Empty list of properties. 

## Actual behavior

```none
Fatal error. System.AccessViolationException: Attempted to read or write protected memory. This is often an indication that other memory is corrupt.
   at System.Management.Automation.Security.NativeMethods.CertGetCertificateContextProperty(IntPtr, CertPropertyId, IntPtr, Int32 ByRef)
   at System.Management.Automation.Security.NativeMethods.CertGetCertificateContextProperty(IntPtr, CertPropertyId, IntPtr, Int32 ByRef)
... etc
```

## Environment data


```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19041
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as duplicate and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Format-List on new X509Certificate2 object causes fatal AccessViolationException
